titleStmt.title: To JOSEPH ELLIS,Joseph Ellis (1815-91) proprietor of the Bedford Hotel, Brighton, 1845-65; son of Joseph Ellis (1783-1858), CD's wine merchant and proprietor of the Star and Garter Hotel, Richmond (where CD frequently dined). For CD's relations with the Ellis family see N.C. Peyrouton, "When the Wine Merchant Wrote to Dickens: The Dickens-Ellis Correspondence", Dickensian 57 (1961): 105-11. 24 DECEMBER 1860

HIGHAM BY ROCHESTER, KENT

body.p: Accept my cordial thanks for the noble and wonderful Paté.For other dispatches of pâté by Joseph Ellis to CD see Pilgrim Letters 5, pp. 261, 467; 10, p. 329. It came on here from London without any delay, and its condition could not be surpassed.
